title: Israel buries final hostage as eyes turn to second phase of ceasefire | ABC NEWS
description: The last Israeli hostage taken by Hamas during the October 7 attack, Ran Gvili, has been laid to rest, turning the page on a painful part of Israel's history.   With all the hostages returned, pressure is now mounting on Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to fully implement the second phase of the Gaza ceasefire deal. title: Airport security increased to prevent Nipah virus spread | The World | ABC NEWS
description: At least seven countries have introduced additional health screening at their borders to prevent the spread of Nipah virus from India. Two cases of the deadly infection were reported in India in December, triggering authorities to place nearly 200 contacts into quarantine. Travellers arriving in Bali and other major Asian airports have expressed relief at the swift response, comparing it to COVID-19 pandemic measures. Angus Mackintosh reports for The World before Girish Sawlani speaks to Dr Kaja Abbas from Nagasaki University about the virus. #ABCTheWorld #ABCAsiaPacific  Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: Whales may be spared euthanasia after marine park exodus | The World | ABC NEWS
description: 30 captive beluga whales are looking for a new home after a marine park in Canada announced it could no longer afford to care for the animals. There were initial fears the whales from Marineland would be euthanised as they cannot safely be released into the wild. But after a conditional government approval was granted to move them to the USA, it appears they may yet survive. Wildlife scientist Dr Vanessa Pirotta joins The World. #ABCTheWorld #ABCAsiaPacific  Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: UK signs major deals with China to strengthen partnership | ABC NEWS
description: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer has told Xi Jinping the UK wants to build a "sophisticated relationship" with China. The two leaders met in Beijing marking the first time a British prime minister had visited China in eight years. The pair signed multiple economic deals, including a landmark deal for UK citizens to travel to China for up to 30 days without a visa. title: Group of school children witness police shooting in Geelong | ABC NEWS
description: Victoria Police say it was a miracle that no children were injured after they were caught up in a police shooting in Geelong, southwest of Melbourne. Two people have been arrested after an allegedly stolen car was driven towards police after crashing into a school bus in Geelong, prompting police to shoot at the vehicle. title: Iranians send Trump a message to 'please help' | ABC NEWS
description: Protesters in Iran are begging Donald Trump to launch military action to help topple the Islamic regime after the US president warned that the warships he's sent to the region are ready to carry out an attack.   The ABC has spoken to several Iranians who have managed to break throught an internet blackout to detail the horrors they've witnessed and appeal for US intervention.   Video by Bridget Rollason. title: US border czar defends bringing in federal 'security' | ABC NEWS
description: US President Donald Trumpâ€™s border czar Tom Homan says immigration enforcement will reduce the number of officers in Minnesota but suggested that it would happen only after "cooperation" from state officials.  Mr Trump sent Mr Homan to Minnesota in the wake of the Saturday shooting of a protester at the hands of Border Patrol.  Mr Homan doubled down on the need for local jails to alert Immigration and Customs Enforcement to people in their custody who ICE can remove from the country.  Reporting via AP.
